page.title: 03BARKING ABBEY &THE CHURCH
page.content: The abbey is in ruins because it was demolished in 1539 by King Henry VIII. This summer people have been excavating there before the ruins are built upon. The foundations can still be seen. It was one of the main abbies in England, and a local secondary school is named after it. {William the {Conqueror}stayed there while the Tower of London was being built. Next to the ruins stands {St. Margaret's Church} which was the medieval parish church. This building dates from the 1700s. The people of Barking used the church while the nuns prayed in the abbey itself. The explorer,{Captain James {Cook,}was married in the church on 21st of December, 1762.
